intro: Dunnia assamica, commonly known as the Assam dunnia, is a flowering plant native to the eastern Himalayas. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. The leaves are used in traditional medicine for their purported anti-inflammatory and antiseptic properties.
